Activity. Inventory turnover (COGS / average inventory) is higher for firms that use
LIFO compared to firms that use FIFO. Under LIFO, COGS is valued at more recent,
higher costs (higher numerator), while inventory is valued at older, lower costs (lower
denominator). Adjusting to FIFO values will result in lower turnover and higher days of
inventory on hand (365 / inventory turnover).
